result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donta Javar Briars

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donta Javar Briars not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Donta Javar Briars.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is withdrawing substitution request at this time. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request for Substitution of Judge.  Received and Filed. nk

Defendant Donta Javar Briars not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Donta Javar Briars.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received an offer and needs time to review with client. Case was mistabbed, should be assigned to Branch 36. Case is adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donta Javar Briars in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Donta Javar Briars in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Donta Javar Briars appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense makes motion to dismiss Count 5 due to misinformation in the 4 corners of the criminal complaint. Motion denied. Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa PD Officer B. Williams. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donta Javar Briars not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with LRJ, RDS, KS, and Macy's.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donta Javar Briars in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Donta Javar Briars in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donta Javar Briars appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 6.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
